title: Calories in Black Olives
meta_description: Learn calories in olives black per 100g, including fat, sodium, carbs, protein, and full nutrition facts for easy tracking.
assumptions: Canned black olives, pitted and drained; standard California-style, no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, curing process, brine content, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of black olives provides ~116 kcal, mostly from healthy monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With 1 tsp olive oil coating per 100g

faqs.q: How many calories in one black olive?
faqs.a: About 5-7 kcal per medium olive (assuming ~5g each).

faqs.q: Are black olives high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~11g fat per 100g, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: What is the sodium content in black olives?
faqs.a: Around 735mg per 100g due to brining; rinse to reduce.

faqs.q: Do black olives have carbs or fiber?
faqs.a: 6.3g carbs and 1.6g fiber per 100g, low glycemic impact.

faqs.q: Calories in black vs green olives?
faqs.a: Similar; black olives ~116 kcal/100g, green ~145 kcal/100g.
